title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Sabaragamuwa, Central, Uva and Southern provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Polonnaruwa districts after 1.00 p.m.

title: Brazil police thwart bomb attack on Lady Gaga concert
byline: Brazilian police said they thwarted a bomb attack planned for Lady Gaga’s concert on Copacabana beach in Rio de Janeiro on Saturday.

title: 19-year-old killed in shooting in Mount Lavinia
byline: A 19-year-old youth has been killed in a shooting incident on Beach Road, Mount Lavinia this morning (05), police said.

title: 2025 LG Polls: Preparation of polling stations begins
byline: The Election Commission says that preparations of the polling stations for the Local Government (LG) Elections will commence this morning (May 5).

title: 2025 LG Polls: Eight more candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: A total of eight candidates have been arrested within the past 24 hours for violating election laws in connection with the 2025 Local Government (LG) election, Police said.

title: Over 1,250 complaints filed with Bribery Commission in first 3 months of 2025
byline: More than 1,250 complaints have been filed with the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) in the first three months of this year.

title: President Dissanayake pays homage at Bai Dinh Pagoda
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited the Bai Dinh Pagoda, one of the largest Buddhist temple complexes in Southeast Asia last afternoon (04), where he paid homage and received blessings.

title: Trump says non-US movies to be hit with 100% tariffs
byline: US President Donald Trump says he will hit movies made in foreign countries with 100% tariffs, as he ramps up trade disputes with nations around the world.

title: Sri Lanka’s “Knights” emerges runners-up at ‘Battle of the Bands’ in India
byline: The Sri Lankan musical group ‘Knights’, which represented the country at the “Battle of the Bands – International” competition held in India, has secured the runner-up position.

title: Vietnamese President hosts official welcome for Sri Lankan counterpart in Hanoi
byline: President of Vietnam Luong Cuong chaired a welcome ceremony for his Sri Lankan counterpart Anura Kumara Dissanayake, at the Presidential Palace in Hanoi this morning (05).

title: Three arrested over hacking to death of man in Mount Lavinia
byline: Three individuals have been arrested in connection with the brutal murder of a man who was hacked to death with a sharp weapons in a vacant plot of land along the Huludagoda Road in Mount Lavinia.

title: Once every 76 years: Sri Lanka to witness Eta Aquarids meteor shower tomorrow
byline: Every spring, Earth passes through a cosmic trail left behind by one of the most famous visitors from the outer solar system: Halley’s Comet. The result is the Eta Aquarids meteor shower, a dazzling display of shooting stars that’s set to peak this year during the night of May 5, 2025 into the early hours of May 6, 2025.

title: Once every 76 years: Sri Lanka to witness Eta Aquarids meteor shower tomorrow
byline: Every spring, Earth passes through a cosmic trail left behind by one of the most famous visitors from the outer solar system: Halley’s Comet. The result is the Eta Aquarids meteor shower, a dazzling display of shooting stars that’s set to peak this year during the night of May 5, 2025 into the early hours of May 6, 2025.

title: CCTV footage emerge of fatal daylight shooting in Mount Lavinia
byline: CCTV footage has emerged of the fatal shooting that took place in broad daylight at a busy intersection near the Beach Road on Colombo – Galle road in Mount Lavinia this morning (05), in which a 19-year-old youth was gunned down by two unidentified assailants.

title: Sri Lanka Customs to publicize names of tax-evaders and entities
byline: Sri Lanka Customs says it intends on making public the names of individuals and institutions found guilty of violating customs laws.

title: Trump orders 100% tariff on foreign-made movies to save ‘dying’ Hollywood
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday announced a 100% tariff on movies produced outside the country, saying the American movie industry was dying a “very fast death” due to the incentives that other countries were offering to lure filmmakers.

title: CID complaint filed over defamatory statement against President AKD
byline: A complaint has been filed with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) against Thusitha Halloluwa, the former Acting Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB) and former Director General of Public Relations to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe...

title: President invites Vietnam’s Vingroup to invest in Sri Lanka
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on a state visit to Vietnam, extended an open invitation to Vietnam’s leading conglomerate, Vingroup, to explore investment opportunities in Sri Lanka’s real estate and tourism sectors.

title: MP Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: Badulla District Member of Parliament Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been further remanded until May 19 by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court, pertaining to a case filed by the Bribery Commission.

title: Several schools closed on May 7
byline: A number of schools will remain closed on Wednesday (May 7) due to the 2025 Local Government (LG) election, the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: LG Election: 35 schools to remain closed on May 7
byline: A number of schools will remain closed on Wednesday (May 7) due to the 2025 Local Government (LG) election, the Ministry of Education has announced.

title: Former Additional Secretary Mahesh Gammanpila granted bail
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has granted bail to Mahesh Gammanpila, the former Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Agriculture, who was previously arrested and remanded in connection with a major corruption investigation.

title: Man jailed over phone ringing in courtroom dies in custody; Family alleges murder
byline: A man who was imprisoned for 14 days after his mobile phone rang inside the Embilipitiya Magistrate’s Court has died while in custody under controversial circumstances, prompting allegations from his family and triggering investigations by prison authorities.

title: Court order issued on gold found during humanitarian operation in N&E
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court ordered that items believed to be gold, found from LTTE camps, illegally operated financial institutions, and other buildings during the humanitarian operation in the North and East, and currently in the custody of the Directorate of Military Intelligence,..

title: Israel plans to capture all of Gaza under new plan, officials say
byline: Israel approved plans on Monday to capture the entire Gaza Strip and remain in the territory for an unspecified amount of time, two Israeli officials said, in a move that if implemented would vastly expand Israel’s operations in the Palestinian territory and likely bring fierce international opposition.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva and 3 others further remanded
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva, who was arrested and remanded for allegedly selling a plot of state-owned land in Kiribathgoda to a private party by forging documents, has been further remanded.

title: Four students remanded over Sabaragamuwa Uni. ragging incident
byline: Four third-year students of Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka, who were arrested over an alleged ragging incident, have been remanded until May 16 by the Balangoda Magistrate’s Court.

title: Mahesh Gammanpila remanded again shortly after granted bail
byline: The former Additional Secretary to the Ministry of Agriculture, Mahesh Gammanpila, who was granted bail in connection with a major corruption investigation this afternoon (05), has been remanded again over his failure to meet the bail conditions.

title: Why do popes choose different names and what could new pope’s name be?
byline: Like the other ceremonies and traditions that accompany the advent of a new pope, his newly chosen name will be imbued with centuries of Catholic history and dissected for its many layers of meaning.

title: Heat warning issued for several provinces
byline: A warm weather advisory has been issued for residents of the Eastern, Northern, North-Western, and North-Central provinces, as well as the Monaragala district.

title: Another 15 Sri Lankans stranded in Myanmar to be rescued
byline: Steps have been taken to rescue another 15 Sri Lankans who were forcibly employed in cybercrime centers in Myawaddy, Myanmar, an official of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has stated.

title: Case against Keheliya and two others postponed until 10 July
byline: The Colombo High Court postponed until 10 July the case filed against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and two others.

title: Sri Lanka, Vietnam sign bilateral agreement and 4 MoUs
byline: Sri Lanka and Vietnam have signed an agreement and four Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in the presence of Vietnamese President Luong Cuong and his Sri Lankan counterpart Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on a state visit to Vietnam.

title: 11 Sabaragamuwa Uni. students suspended over ragging incident
byline: The academic activities of 11 students of Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka have been suspended over the death of a student allegedly due to ragging, the police said.

title: CBSL launches Sustainable Finance Roadmap 2.0
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has launched the Sustainable Finance Roadmap 2.0 on 05 May 2025 at the Atrium of CBSL, marking a key milestone in its continued efforts to foster a climate-resilient and socially inclusive financial system.

title: Sri Lanka gears up for 2025 Local Govt Election tomorrow
byline: The 2025 Local Government Elections is scheduled to commence at 7.00 a.m. tomorrow (May 06).
